title.narrative: Advanced agriculture for sustainable growth through improved potato crop in Iraq

description.narrative: Farmers have increased yield and improved the quality of their farm output, through technical and hardware assistance and have access to markets in Al Rasheed area – Baghdad, by December 2022.

Since 2003 continuous conflict, instability and less Government attention severely affected agriculture and agro-based industry in Iraq. Whereas use of low-quality inputs, low yield, limited protection of national products and cheap import of agricultural products restricted growth of agro-based industry and high-quality agricultural production in Iraq.
The project will be focusing on the increased farm production of at least 400 small-holder farmers including farmers at Ataa AlKhaleej farm and agricultural area around Latifaya farm and in Al Rasheed area. To increase crop yield, the project will encourage farmers to use improved agriculture inputs e.g. Dutch seed potatoes from Interseed Holland company (Consortium private partner) and advanced agricultural mechanics. The improved yield will be sold to food processing businesses and to crop retailers in local market – the businesses will establish contract farming with targeted farmers groups. ZOA, together with Cordaid and Al Khamiyat and Interseed will train and encourage farmers to participate in the project by attending on-farm capacity building training sessions, forming farmers groups and by adopting advance agricultural and irrigation methods for potato crop.
As a result, 100 farmers and their families, currently not being able to farm on their land, or having a limited yield, will be able to increase their income by more than 50% and more 30% of their farm production. Whereas all 400 farmers will learn climate smart agriculture practices to enhance their farm production.
The project contributes to National Development Plan 2018-2022 for agriculture sector and is in line with the policy of the Netherlands Development Cooperation for Iraq, which focuses on the development of the agriculture sector and stimulating employment and entrepreneurship opportunities in Iraq. The project and partnership contribute to SDGs 5, 8 12 and 17 by improving agricultural practices and engage local businesses.

title.narrative: Number of households with more diversified livelihoods (income generation)

description.narrative: Number of households that have been able to diversify their primary livelihood through Cordaid interventions on this field. Diversification here means the process by which rural families construct a diverse portfolio of activities and social support capabilities in order to survive and to improve their standards of living.
Number of people who have benefitted (directly or indirectly) through a Cordaid Sustainable Livelihoods Intervention

title.narrative: % of feedback and valid complaints received that are responded to/resolved

description.narrative: Percent of feedback and valid complaints received at project or country/field office level, via Cordaid, a partner or consortium member that are respond to and/or resolved (in accordance with Cordaid FCM minimum standards). This excludes invalid and sensitive complaints.

title.narrative: The project integrates climate risks in programming

description.narrative: The integration of climate risks in programming includes an undertaking of concrete actions to reduce and/or mitigate risks related to climate change impact and disaster risks ( for example droughts, erosion, salinization, flooding, etc.) The projects we refer to could be on the themes of health education, justice, security, disaster management, finance and livelihoods.
